results.title: A different perspective
results.brief_description: ‘I was given a photo pass to the 1994 Big Day Out. From then on, outside my day job I worked as a freelance photographer’. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Telling Tales’.
results.description: ‘I was given a photo pass to the 1994 Big Day Out. From then on, outside my day job I worked as a freelance photographer’. results.title: Cardin Street
results.brief_description: A little piece of wood tells a whole story about a house, about home, about friendship. A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.

results.title: The Brown dressing gown
results.brief_description: Patric fondly remembers his social worker Julie Wilson who helped him come out of his cocoon and discard his brown dressing gown. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and The Deafness Foundation.

results.title: Absolution
results.brief_description: A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop Telling Tales. Produced in partnership with Arts Access and supported by the Department of Human Services and the Deafness Foundation for Telling Tales.

results.title: Synthing
results.brief_description: Synthing is the result of years of exploratory work across disciplines. “The Synthing concept puts expressive and energetic body movement in front of a video camera interface to create an engrossing interplay of music and images within the framework of a cybermedium… a synaesthetic compositional tool”, says Gruchy. Synthing, through its use of real-time navigation and interactive technologies, allows real opportunities for audience interaction.
